metadata.title: A Computational Approach to Design Potential siRNA Molecules as a Prospective Tool for Silencing Nucleocapsid Phosphoprotein and 2 Surface Glycoprotein Gene of SARS-CoV-2 3 4

abstract.text: Mohammad Ali Moni) 13 14 ABSTRACT 15 16 An outbreak, caused by a RNA virus, SARS-CoV-2 named COVID-19 has become pandemic with a 17 magnitude which is daunting to all public health institutions in the absence of specific antiviral 18 treatment. Surface glycoprotein and nucleocapsid phosphoprotein are two important proteins of this 19 virus facilitating its entry into host cell and genome replication. Small interfering RNA (siRNA) is a 20 prospective tool of the RNA interference (RNAi) pathway for the control of human viral infections 21 by suppressing viral gene expression through hybridization and neutralization of target 22 complementary mRNA. So, in this study, the power of RNA interference technology was harnessed 23 to develop siRNA molecules against specific target genes namely, nucleocapsid phosphoprotein 24 gene and surface glycoprotein gene. Conserved sequence from 139 SARS-CoV-2 strains from 25 around the globe was collected to construct 78 siRNA that can inactivate nucleocapsid 26 phosphoprotein and surface glycoprotein genes. Finally, based on GC content, free energy of 27
folding, free energy of binding, melting temperature and efficacy prediction process 8 siRNA 28 molecules were selected which are proposed to exerts the best action. These predicted siRNAs 29
should effectively silence the genes of SARS-CoV-2 during siRNA mediated treatment assisting in 30 the response against SARS-CoV-2 31 32

body_text.text: COVID-19, A pandemic affecting lives of billions of people worldwide, has confronted humanity in 37 the commencement of 2020, is caused by a viral pathogen, severe acute respiratory syndrome 38 coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) or 2019-nCoV. Initial symptoms of this disease mainly include fever, 39 cough, fatigue, dyspnea & headache [1, 2] or it may be asymptomatic [3] . The spike glycoprotein of 40 SARS-CoV-2 binds directly with the surface cell angiotensin converting enzyme II (ACE2) receptor 41 present on alveolar epithelial cells of lung facilitating virus entry, replication and triggers cytokine 42 cascade mechanism [4] . In severe cases, patient may die due to massive alveolar damage and 43 progressive respiratory failure [1, 5] . The current detection process of SARS-CoV-2 carried out by 44 most countries is using real-time RT-PCR, although several other methods are also being 45 developed [6] [7] [8] . Incubation period for the virus ranges between 2-14 days [9] and in some cases, 46

transmission is also reported during asymptomatic period [10] . Some recent studies suggest that bats 47 are likely reservoir hosts for SARS-Cov-2 but the identity of the intermediate host that might have 48 facilitated transfer to human still remain elusive with some studies indicating pangolins [11] . 49 SARS-CoV-2 is assumed to spread mainly from person-to-person through respiratory droplets 50 produced when an infected person sneezes and coughs or between people who are in close 51 contact [5] . 52 53
Coronaviruses are genetically classified into four main genera: Alphacoronavirus, Betacoronavirus, 54

Gammacoronavirus, and Deltacoronavirus [12] . The first two genera generally infect mammals, 55 while the last two mostly cause disease in birds. CoV-2 from around the world. Phylogenetic analysis revealed that a small number sequences form 234 significant clades with a bootstrap value greater than 60%. (Fig 2, Supplementary Table 8 ). 235
Conserved portions that are shorter than 21 nucleotides were omitted from further analysis. 236

Conserved sequences were put to siDirect web server to identify possible targets and to generate 237 corresponding siRNAs. siDirect performs the task in three distinct steps -highly functional siRNA 238 selection, seed-dependent off-target effects reduction, near-perfect matched genes elimination. 239 siRNA targets were found in 18 conserved regions, 5 nucleocapsid phosphoprotein (Supplementary  240  Table 4 ) and 13 surface glycoprotein (Supplementary Table 5 the prediction of prospective secondary structure and determination of free energy of corresponding 263

folding is crucial. Here, guide strands of predicted siRNAs were subjected to RNA structure web 264 server in order to predict possible folding structures and corresponding minimum free energies. At 265 37•C, finally selected siRNAs have free energy of folding greater than zero (Fig 3, Table 2 ), which 266
suggests the predicted siRNAs are more accessible for efficient binding. Table 6 & Supplementary table 7) . Finally selected 272
siRNAs have free energy of binding equal or below -30.0 (Fig 4, Table 2 ), which suggests the 273 predicted siRNAs are more interactive with their corresponding targets. 274 275

The collective heat capacity, denoted as Cp, is plotted as a function of temperature and the melting 276 temperature, denoted as Tm (Cp), was determined. In this study, eight prospective siRNA molecules were proposed to be efficient at binding and 289

cleaving specific mRNA targets of SARS-CoV-2 ( into the endosomes. siRNA escape endosomes and release siRNA into the cytoplasm due to pH 503 responsive mechanism or proton sponge effect. Once generated, siRNA is loaded into RNA-indiced 504 silencing complex comprising of RNA-binding protein TRBP and Argonaute (AGO2). AGO2 opts 505 the siRNA guide strand, then excises and ejects the passenger strand. After that, the guide strand 506 pairs with its complementary target mRNA and AGO2 slices the target. After slicing, the cleaved 507 target mRNA is released and RISC is recycled for another few rounds of slicing using the same 508 guide strand [55]. 509 510 Fig. 2 . Radial phylogenetic tree of A. nucleocapsid phosphoprotein and B. surface glycoprotein 511
using 139 strains of SARS-CoV-2 from around the world. The bootstrap value for tree construction 512 was set to 500 and Tamura-Nei model of evolution was used for both trees. 513 514 Fig. 3

TABREF1.text: Best effective siRNA molecules with various parameters. Computation of RNA-RNA interaction through thermodynamics 140 141Higher interaction between the target and the guide strand serves a better predictor for siRNA 142 efficacy. Therefore, the thermodynamic interaction between the target strand and the siRNA guide 143 strand was predicted with the aid of DuplexFold [51] program of the RNA structure web server http://crdd.osdd.net/raghava/sirnapred/index.html) was used to validate the 158 predicted siRNA species. The predicted siRNAs were evaluated against the Main21 dataset using 159 support vector machine algorithm and the binary pattern prediction approach.
